top_comment.text: Stuff just got real﻿
top_comment.author: Daemont “the swift” Serperior

comments.text:
+lucaboris As you said, "in my country" and "I think," so must I argue that 
others' feelings have merit as well. 
In the context of the original post, Daemont is trying to do what he feels 
is improving himself, and he's being criticized for it. I applaud him for 
trying to respect others' feelings. 
Some folks, like myself, have been raised to believe that some words are 
just plain offensive, regardless of context, and it's nothing short of 
self-improvement to try and expand one's vocabulary so as not to resort to 
"gutter talk," "profanity," etc. Here in the States, language has a 
profound effect on some people. and most television networks try to respect 
that. 
My two cents; take them or leave them.
comments.author: JesseMcCloud

comments.text:
+JesseMcCloud Okay if you insist. The people who censor curse words are not 
the ones who form a higher truth on such matters, and as an example in my 
country curse words are never censored on tv so your argument is just plain 
useless. The only reason why in the states they censor those words, is that 
some people are highly sensitive to those words, I argue for the wrong 
reasons. 
If someone hit his toe and says "fuck!".I'm not offended, and I think no 
one ought to be offended. Only when words are use in an offensive and 
personal context should people be offended.

So yeah, here's your argument. But I dont make a habbit of discussing with 
people who can produce logical statements, because I'm certain this wont 
lead to anything productive.
comments.author: lucaboris

comments.text: +lucaboris Because you have no counter-arguments?
comments.author: JesseMcCloud

comments.text: +JesseMcCloud What a stupid argument
comments.author: lucaboris

comments.text:
+lucaboris Were that true, it wouldn't be bleeped out of all public (and 
some cable) television.
comments.author: JesseMcCloud

comments.text:
I think cursing has more to do with the use of the words, not the actually

comments.author: Captain Dornaden

comments.text:
There's a lot of time spent on things you might not realize.  For instance, 
we can't just go down to the giant-old-industrial-buildings-store and pick 
up a few locations for a film.  That takes weeks of scouting for locations 
(usually hours away) that will allow us to film on their premises.  And 
there's 3 different locations like that in this episode.  And when you need 
20 people for a scene including 10 important characters, you can't just say 
"let's do it tomorrow."  You have to wait till everyone' schedules line up. 
 But also, as you can tell from the end teaser - we've also shot episode 6. 
 With the locations and big cast, it was more efficient to film ep 5 and 6 
back-to-back before editing episode 5.  If you try to reproduce something 
like this, you'll discover a lot of things take time that you probably 
never thought of like constructing costumes and props, waiting on mail 
orders, composing an entire original score, etc.

captions.text: Previously on Mario Warfare...

Sometimes a princess has to do what is right
for her kingdom.
Teach me how to wage a war.
You'll need an army.
But Bowser destroyed our military.

There is a place where the greatest brawlers
gather to test their skills.
Mario, you thinking what I'm thinking?

Yeah. Few more fights, and we'll have enough
coin to go home.
You will defeat their champion.
Mario! Mario! Mario!
Where have I see that girl before?
Alright monkey, let's see what you got.
Not me. Her.

Look lady, it's like I told Zelda: I ain't
fighting no girls.
You know my name is Link, jerk!

Now if your friend wants to fight, I'm sure
we'd all appreciate some sandwiches when we're done.
Did you just hit me with a stool-
Not bad.
Knock it off! I'm not gonna fight you!
OK, new rule: Mario now fights girls.
Oh god, see? This is why we don't fight girls-

Mario, who is that girl? I know I've seen
her somewhere before!
Whatever, Luigi.
That's it! I remember!
Holy shi-. Mario, it's the Princess!
Princess!?
(crowd whispering)
Come on, get up! Get up!
No, you win...your majesty.
No, please. Please don't.
I'm not here as your princess.
I'm a refugee like you.
My name is Peach.
Daughter to a murdered King.
Heir to a fallen throne.
Bowser will not stop.
He's taken Hyrule...
Eagleland...
He's captured all of Pallet Town...
Dreamland has fallen to his Armada...

You survived Bowser's attack because of your
ability to fight.

But you weren't strong enough to fight off
his army...
...not alone.
But united we stand a chance.
You'll have my master sword.
And my bat.
And my gloves.
And my barrel.
And my balls!
You got my wrench.
You got my plunger.
Bowser may have started this war...
but together, we'll damn sure finish it!
Now we're playing with power!

Yo princess, I seem to be having a bit of
an issue here.
Don't worry about it.
I've got a different plan for you.
I am so ready to kick some ass!
Upsie daisy, Mario!
You're not coming with me this time, Luigi.
What are you talking about?

If anything were to happen to you, I couldn't
live with myself.

It doesn't matter what happens to me, or to
you!
This is about something more important!
This is about everyone in the Mushroom Kingdom!
I know! And I can't do what I have to do-

I can't protect these people...I can't defeat
Bowser-
with you on my back.
What? I slow you down? Is that it?
Little brother Luigi slows down super Mario!
Weegee!
You need me Mario!

I know I do! That's why I need you to stay
here
where it's safe.
Mario?
Sorry, Luigi.
Lord Bowser, it was just as you predicted:

The final ingredient was discovered in the
Mushroom Kingdom.
The Red Mushroom Serum is complete.
You've done well, Kamek.

With this serum, you will have unimaginable
power.
Nothing will be able to stop you.
Muhuhwahahaha!
On the next episode....
Translated by (your name here)
